title.narrative: OUTPUT2.1.6 EQTBL.ACCESS TO Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVIC

description.narrative: Output 2.1.6 Local authorities and communities in selected municipalities promote better access to adequate sanitation in primary health care centres and in schools, and the adoption of good hygiene practices by school children, women and families., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2.1 Equit. Access to Quality Services by 2016 with the focus on the most vulnerable groups in specifically targeted areas, more women, girls and boys have access to and use a continuum of integrated social services, including sanitation services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.1.6 Local authorities and communities in selected municipalities promote better access to adequate sanitation in primaryhealth care centres and in schools, and the adoption of good hygiene practices by school children, women and families.

description.narrative: Children and pregnant women enjoy access to improved water supply and sanitation facilities in ten healthcare facilities and all schools in the country have guidance on how to make school facilities girl-friendly. | Status:Met | As-of Date:25/12/2017

title.narrative: % of schools and pre-schools in 55 municipalities that promote safe hygiene practices for children in line with UNICEF recommended standards.

actual.value: 2017:In 2017 schools and preschools of target municipalities maintained WASH promotion activities among children. National counterpart from the Ministry of Education and Science visited randomly selected schools and confirmed continued hygiene promotion using the UNICEF developed WASH guidebook. UNICEF s

actual.value: 2016:In 2016, UNICEF Kyrgyzstan focused on upstream policy work and did not carry out any hardware renovation activities. Country Office continued advocating for improving access to water supply, sanitation and hygiene in education institutions, using evidence generated through research and modeling.
